Posted By: Pantheon (9/25/2009 9:21:14 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
ArKive, it is funny that you mention warpworld + landfall  
  
a friend of mine runs warpworld, and if landfall triggers in a warp, then you can get a devistating combo basicly placing your whole deck after a few warps with rampaging baloth, emeria angel, and seige gang comander  
  
the deck uses keeper of progenitus to power out warps at turn 5 (turn 4 is required to play the keeper, with out any other mana acceleration)  
  
our last game with warpworld, we went through 10 warps, and I am telling you, there are only 3 ways to effectively counter a warpworld, Blue [gather specimens](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=gather specimens), a deck designed to warp, ie another warpworld deck, or an ally deck running a play set of [turntimber ranger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=turntimber ranger), and with the ally, you cross your fingers and hope you hit at least 1 turntimber early in the resolution giving you more permanents for the next warp  
  
and Ob, I see him in a few landfall g/b decks with the g/b fetch

posts.post_content:
For a mythic rare, I also must say it's not all that rare. I got one in a fat pack, and my friend got three within a week of Zendikar being out.   
  
Without fetchlands, I wouldn't say he's that great. [Whispersilk Cloak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Whispersilk Cloak) him and then he's a major threat. But without something like that, he's still good for life drain, and that gets annoying fast.

Posted By: PhyrexianLobbiest (10/21/2009 10:52:17 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Ob used to be Garruk, he lost to Lily and we got this beast... sucks to be him.  
  
I agree that trample feels better (since he used to be green and all), however on a card like this it would push him over the edge... there is already a small enough window to deal with him (outside of white who can hide behind a Baneslayer) before he kills you.  
  
  
What's funny is that the power creep that creates cards like this keeps the game interesting... how far can they push things and keep it balanced?  
  
Remember when a one drop had a total of 2 between it's power and toughness? Now, look at how many one drops are available with a total of 3-4 power/toughness in standard. They are making the game more aggro and good mid-range to control decks will continue to get harder to find.  
  
  
So, how do you rate an Ob Nixilis? Well, on the Planeswalker turned creature scale he beats the pants off a Blind Seer (Urza)! The fact is, no matter how much we may want to rant about this creature being broken, if he's in ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Ob used to be Garruk, he lost to Lily and we got this beast... sucks to be him.

I agree that trample feels better (since he used to be green and all), however on a card like this it would push him over the edge... there is already a small enough window to deal with him (outside of white who can hide behind a Baneslayer) before he kills you.


What's funny is that the power creep that creates cards like this keeps the game interesting... how far can they push things and keep it balanced?

Remember when a one drop had a total of 2 between it's power and toughness? Now, look at how many one drops are available with a total of 3-4 power/toughness in standard. They are making the game more aggro and good mid-range to control decks will continue to get harder to find.


So, how do you rate an Ob Nixilis? Well, on the Planeswalker turned creature scale he beats the pants off a Blind Seer (Urza)! The fact is, no matter how much we may want to rant about this creature being broken, if he's in ... (see all)

Posted By: repka1257 (10/12/2009 1:43:36 AM)

posts.post_content:
I'm guessing the combo I'm thinking of doesnt work, because nobody has mentioned [Warp World](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Warp World) in conjunction with Ob Nixilis. is this because they all enter the battlefield at the same time? I do not know, but thought it was worth mentioning  
Played in some kind of permanent swarm/draw power deck, running [Noble Hierarch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Noble Hierarch), [Birds of Paradise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Birds of Paradise), [Lotus Cobra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lotus Cobra), [Harrow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Harrow), fetch lands, anything to ramp your mana to get Ob Nix out on 3rd or 4th turn. 4th, 5th or 6th turn sees you drop a Warp World. picking up and shuffling everything, dropping 3 Ob Nix and 3 Land = win, or 2 Ob Nix and 4 Land = win. Even 1 Ob Nix can solo your opponent if you manage to drop 7 lands (3 basic and 2 fetch lands, for 2 more basic).  
  
Due to Ob Nix being legendary, they will all self-destruct, but their landfall effects will not have resolved yet, so you are able to put Ob Nix onto the field, having them die and head for ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
I'm guessing the combo I'm thinking of doesnt work, because nobody has mentioned Warp World in conjunction with Ob Nixilis. is this because they all enter the battlefield at the same time? I do not know, but thought it was worth mentioning
Played in some kind of permanent swarm/draw power deck, running Noble Hierarch, Birds of Paradise, Lotus Cobra, Harrow, fetch lands, anything to ramp your mana to get Ob Nix out on 3rd or 4th turn. 4th, 5th or 6th turn sees you drop a Warp World. picking up and shuffling everything, dropping 3 Ob Nix and 3 Land = win, or 2 Ob Nix and 4 Land = win. Even 1 Ob Nix can solo your opponent if you manage to drop 7 lands (3 basic and 2 fetch lands, for 2 more basic).

Due to Ob Nix being legendary, they will all self-destruct, but their landfall effects will not have resolved yet, so you are able to put Ob Nix onto the field, having them die and head for ... (see all)
